alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alleghany County in west central Virginia and southeastern Greenbrier Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 600 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greenbrier State Forest, or near White Sulphur Springs, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... White Sulphur Springs... Greenbrier State Forest... Alvon... Roaring Mountain Summit... and Callaghan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
